faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
Topics covered by the course include: 
*Localization
*Mapping
*Simultaneous localization and mapping
*Motion planning
*Control
*Sensing and perception
*Sensor fusion
*Interaction and behavior modelling
*End-to-end approaches
description.et:
Õppeainel käsitletavad teemad:
* Lokaliseerimine
* Kaardistamine
* Samaaegne lokaliseerimine ja kaardistamine
* Liikumise kavandamine
* Kontroll
* Tunnetamine ja tajumine
* Anduri liitmine
* Interaktsioonide ja käitumise modelleerimine
* Otsast lõpuni lähenemised

objectives.en: In the context of robotics in general, "autonomous" refers to the ability of a robot to operate without the intervention of a human operator. And the same definition applies to autonomous driving i.e. the ability of a vehicle to drive itself without the intervention of a human.
objectives.et: Robootika vaatenurgast üldiselt viitab "autonoomsus" või "ise juhitavus" roboti võimele töötada ilma inimeste sekkumiseta. Sama määratlus kehtib ise juhtiva sõiduki juhtimise osas, näiteks sõiduki võime liikuda ja end juhtida ilma inimeste sekkumiseta.

objectives.en: This is an introductory course to autonomous driving. It covers different techniques and sub-systems needed to endow vehicles with autonomy. This includes the ability of a vehicle to perceive its environment, map its environment and localize itself within a map, plan its motion in its environment, execute that motion smoothly, as well as detect, model and predict behavior of other agents present in its environment.
objectives.et: See on sissejuhatav kursus autonoomse sõitmise teemal. Kursus hõlmab erinevaid tehnikaid ja alamsüsteeme, mis on vajalikud sõidukite ise juhitavuse tagamiseks. See hõlmab sõiduki võimet tajuda oma keskkonda, kaardistada oma keskkonda ja lokaliseerida ennast kaardil, kavandada oma liikumist enda keskkonnas, teostada seda liikumist sujuvalt, samuti tuvastada, modelleerida ja ennustada teiste selles keskkonnas esinevate agentide käitumist.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, a student will be able to:
I.	Implement map-based localization using particle filtering
learning_outcomes.et: I. Rakendama kaardipõhist lokaliseerimist osakeste filtreerimise abil

learning_outcomes.en: II.	Implement SLAM on simulated exteroceptive and proprioceptive data
learning_outcomes.et: II. Rakendama SLAM-i simuleeritud eksterotseptiivsete ja propriotseptiivsete andmete jaoks

learning_outcomes.en: III.	Explain different planning strategies for robot motion planning
learning_outcomes.et: III. Selgitama erinevaid robotite liikumise kavandamise strateegiaid

learning_outcomes.en: IV.	Implement a control strategy for lateral position control
V.	Describe challenges in behavior modelling in autonomous driving
learning_outcomes.et: V. Kirjeldama väljakutseid käitumise modelleerimisel autonoomses sõidus

learning_outcomes.en: VI.	Understand the pros and cons of different exteroceptive sensing systems used in autonomous driving
learning_outcomes.et: VI. Mõistma erinevate ekstratseptiivsete andurite tajumissüsteemide plusse ja miinuseid, mida kasutatakse ise autonoomses sõidus

learning_outcomes.en: VII.	Understand the steps involved in employing a sensing system
learning_outcomes.et: VII. Saama aru andurisüsteemi kasutuselevõtu etappidest

independent_work.et: The instructions are given by lecturer

description.et: In order to pass the course, a student needs to complete each lab task in each lab session (graded based on submitted report and code)
achieve at least 50% average score in the three oral exams held during the course.

grade_preconditions.et: In order to pass the course, a student needs to complete each lab task in each lab session (graded based on submitted report and code) as well as achieve at least 50% average score in the three oral exams held during the course.

grade_evaluation.et: In order to pass the course, a student needs to complete each lab task in each lab session (graded based on submitted report and code) as well as achieve at least 50% average score in the three oral exams held during the course.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
